alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Lewis and Clark; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 1:12AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and west central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Cascade. In north central Montana, Teton. In west central Montana, Lewis and Clark. * WHEN...Until 415 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 112 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Simms and Sun River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
